dkeep.logic

Class GameCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.GameCharacter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Guard, Hero, Ogre

    public abstract class GameCharacter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Abstract class that represents a generic Game Character.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameCharacter

        public GameCharacter(int[] initial_pos,
                     char... symb)
        Game Character Constructor. Creates a new Character in the given position, with the given symbols.
        Parameters:
        initial_pos - Initial Character Position
        symbs - Symbols used to represent the Character

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(GameMap gameMap,
                   int row,
                   int col)
        Function responsible for updating the Character position in the given map, to the position (row, col). The position of the Character is dependent of gameMap characteristics. This function is used for player controlled movement.
        Parameters:
        gameMap - Map used for updating Character position
        row - row of the Matrix to be updated
        col - Col of the Matrix to be updated

      • update

        public abstract void update(GameMap gameMap)
        Function responsible for updating the Character position in the given map. The position of the Character is dependent of gameMap characteristics.
        Parameters:
        gameMap - Map used for updating character position

      • attack

        public boolean attack(GameCharacter c)
        Check if this Character attacked the given Character.
        Parameters:
        c - Game Character used
        Returns:
        true if this Character attacked, false if not.

      • isAt

        public boolean isAt(int[] pos)
        Parameters:
        pos - Given position
        Returns:
        true if character is at the given position, false if not

      • setSymbIdx

        public boolean setSymbIdx(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - index of the symbol
        Returns:
        True if the Character's symbol was set to the symbol at index i, false if not.

      • nextSymb

        public void nextSymb()
        Change current symbol to the next available symbol

      • draw

        public void draw(char[][] board)
        Draws the current Character in the matrix of chars board, using the current symbol.
        Parameters:
        board - Matrix of chars where the Character will be drawn
